bibl.title: Letter from Frances F. Agramonte to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 1, 1932

div1.p: Frances Agramonte gives Kean her new address and discusses her health.

div1.head: Letter from Frances F. Agramonte to Jefferson Randolph Kean, February 1, 1932
div1.opener:
Can keep
FPA
21 #263 B. 3er piso,
Vedado, Havana,
Feb 1 st, 1932.
My dear Gen Kean:
div1.p:
Only a word
to inform you that a-
bout the 15th of this
month we will move
to Calle I # 39 Let 17th &
19th Sts. Vedado.

This change is due to
my prolonged illness &
the doctor believe it is
better for me to be on
a ground floor so I
can get some sun &
more fresh air. I have
been confined to my
bed since Dec 11th and
now only get up a
couple of hours a day.

Always very grateful
for all your interest
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Frances F. de Agramonte
AC
K
Senators Th.J. Walsh of
Montana
W. Warren Barbour
N. J.
are interested
